title: Wolff 2016 Old Vines Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Very showy aromas of daffodils and white peach meet with sea salt and vanilla on the nose of this bottling. There is good grip to the sip, where flavors of lime, grapefruit and sliced orange arise.

title: Wölffer 2016 Perle Chardonnay (The Hamptons, Long Island)
description: Initially shy on the nose, aromas of lime blossom, gardenia and crushed stone slowly creep from the glass. There's a pleasant tension to the slightly rounded palate, with flavors of pineapple rind and melon melding on a tangy wet stone undercurrent.

title: Batasiolo 2012 Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Scorched earth, underbrush, grilled porcini, chopped herb and leather aromas take center stage. The earthy full-bodied palate evokes dried black cherry, prune, star anise and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside drying, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink sooner rather than later.

title: Benanti 2016 Rosso  (Etna)
description: Truffle, crushed mint and red berry aromas mingle with a whiff of wild rose. The aromas carry through to the light-bodied, racy palate along with white pepper and a citrus note. A hint of oyster shell gives it a tangy finish.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: Loads of sun-kissed grapefruit, quince and lemon flavors collide on the palate of this fruit-forward sip. It's uncomplicated and juicy, yet balanced by zesty lime acidity and a hint of minerality. The finish is brisk and clean.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 DOM Off-Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pure, pristine flavors of white grapefruit, lemon and lime lend an exhilarating freshness to this off-dry Riesling. Subtle nuances of wax and pollen accentuate the midpalate, but overall, it's a thirst-quenching, easy-drinking wine.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2013 Judge Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: Made entirely from the one variety, this is bright and floral in red-fruit and lavender notes, as well as the darker side of the grape: compost, turned earth and barnyard leather. It shows power and full-bodied ripeness while maintaining varietal integrity.

title: Canard-Duchêne NV Léonie Brut  (Champagne)
description: Named after Léonie Duchêne, who created this producer, this wine is crisp and drier than most from the house. With taut minerality as well as some weight, it is made mainly from red grapes. Drink this bottling now.

title: Casa Primicia 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, savory aromas of leathery berry fruits come with an animal note. This warm-vintage Reserva is dense and feels like it's piling on top of itself. Roasted, spicy berry flavors are slightly leafy, while oak spice is lasting on a solid, chunky finish.

title: Cascina Chicco 2014 Rocche di Castelletto  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of red berry, underbrush and a balsamic note emerge from the glass. The solid palate shows black cherry, star anise and clove alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Chappellet 2016 Mountain Cuvée Proprietor's Red (Napa Valley)
description: This rounded, approachable blend is well-made, blending 51% Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller percentages of Merlot, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Concentrated in big, burly black fruit, it offers accents of tobacco and mocha around a thick midpalate and finishing touch of char.

title: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2017 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)
description: This young wine still has a stalky character, but the rich fruit and warm tannins hold promise for the future. Drink this ripe, spicy wine with fruitcake flavors from 2020.

title: Coelho 2015 Family Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Just one barrel was made, and it was aged for 18 months. Oak-driven aromas open into flavors of toasted coconut and roasted cashews. The medium-bodied berry fruit is clean and fresh, with highlights of orange peel and chocolate.

title: Curto 2015 Nero d'Avola (Eloro)
description: Dark berry, Mediterranean brush and carob aromas take center stage. Made with Nero d'Avola, the smooth, juicy palate delivers ripe blackberry, ground pepper and clove alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Domaine du Vieux Bourg NV Jean-Marie et Noël Girard Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)
description: That Cabernet Franc makes fine sparkling Crémant in the Loire is obvious from this red-currant-flavored, crisp-textured wine. It is full of sparkling fruitiness, vibrant with acidity and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine Gueneau 2017 Les Terres Blanches  (Sancerre)
description: Crisp, herbal and apple flavored, this perfumed wine is ripe, full in the mouth and still young. It has great acidity and a tight mineral texture. The wine comes from 25-year-old vines that add concentration to the fruits. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2017 Villa Paulus  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Named after the Roman villa that once existed in Pouilly-sur-Loire (and which gave its name to Pouilly), this wine comes from old vines giving concentrated citrus and green-fruit flavors. Bright, crisp and tangy, the wine could do with some aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Paul Thomas 2017 Silex  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from a parcel of vines planted on flint soil close to the Loire river. It is tense and mineral, with swathes of rich citrus, lively acidity and a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Fairsing 2016 Dardis Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: The Dardis cuvée is taut and citric and shows wild berry fruit. Barreled for 10 months in 30% new French oak, it shows little impact of barrel flavors at this point in time; just the slightest hint of caramel streaking through the finish.

title: Famille Duveau 2016  Saumur-Champigny
description: This fruity wine is full of ripe red-cherry flavors, with a touch of smoky tannins. It has a delicious, juicy character, very open while also having a balanced structure. From vineyards to the east of the city of Saumur, the wine is bright and ready to drink.
